	Subject: Re: [junit] organizing tests using annotations
	
	
	Bradley, Todd wrote:
	> Hi, the unit test suite on a particular project of mine has
grown to the
	> point where I need to organize it some.  I'd like to do
something like
	> Rainsberger's JUnit recipe 4.6 "Separate the different kinds
of test
	> suites"***.  But for some reason I can't verbalize I don't
like the
	> approach of classifying tests using a tag interface.
	
	I literally move the source code: I have one source tree for
fast tests, 
	one for slow tests, and so on. I've never wanted to have a
single test 
	case class be in two categories at once. (Go ahead, Cedric...
tell him 
	about TestNG. :) )
	
	> Instead, since I'm using Java 5, I'd prefer to use
annotations.  Does
	> anyone have an example TestFilter implementation that uses
annotations
	> instead of tag interfaces?  Or is there some other tool I
should be
	> looking into?
	
	Since tag interfaces are a poor man's annotations, this should
be easy 
	enough to do. Write some Learning Tests for how to discover
whether a 
	class has a certain annotation! :)
	-- 
	J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
